title: Pods vs. Containers ğŸ“¦
ques: What is the smallest deployable unit in Kubernetes?
explanation: A **Pod** is the smallest execution unit in Kubernetes. It can contain one or more containers that share storage and network.

title: Listing Pods ğŸ•µï¸
ques:
You want to see the status of all pods in the current namespace.

Write the command.
explanation: **`kubectl get pods`** lists all pods, showing their status (Running, Pending, etc.) and age.

title: Deployments ğŸš€
ques:
You want to ensure 3 replicas of your application are always running and handle rolling updates automatically.

Which resource type should you use?
explanation: A **Deployment** manages a set of identical Pods, ensuring the desired number are running and handling updates.

title: Services ğŸŒ
ques:
You want to expose a set of Pods to the network so other applications can access them stably.

Which resource type provides a stable IP address and load balancing for Pods?
explanation: A **Service** provides an abstract way to expose an application running on a set of Pods as a network service.
